metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11768 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.9.0.1. A vulnerability wasreported where a specially crafted database name can be used to trigger anSQL injection attack through the designer feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.5+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.5+dfsg1-2').
